website_summaries.verdict: If you love your GoPro gear, you might as well stick with the company's official suction cup mount, which works well.
pros: Made to fit numerous GoPro camera models
Very trustworthy suction cup that will attach to vehicles running at extremely high speeds
Includes a quick release base unit that'll make it easy to move the attached camera to a new location
cons: Doesn't work with as many other models of cameras as we'd like to see

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS PICTURED, BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: The GoPro Head Strap was pictured as having a quick disconnect for the mount! The model I received does not! I wanted the quick mount to go with the GoPro floating handle (that has the quick mount) so when I am jet skiing I do not have to fiddle with a thumb screw when on the water to change between mounts! This was a very disappointing purchase for me. This is the first purchase from Amazon I have not been happy with. Because the Head Strap was inexpensive I am not returning it as it is too much trouble for me. I will be buying another not sure from who?
customer_reviews.author: Gregory P.

customer_reviews.title: Better be good at spatial relationships...
customer_reviews.text: The product is constructed well, and comes with a lot of parts... The suction mount is strong and you can rotate the assembly to allow for alignment... It comes with no instructions at all, not even a picture... So you must figure out what goes best with what on your own... :/ Overall the product is ok. GoPro is not known for including any kind of comprehensive instructions, not even with their cameras. But, for me no instructions...no stars!!! I would recommend this product..
customer_reviews.author: ChuckleHead

customer_reviews.title: NOT "by GoPro" as it claims
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Plus misrepresented. I purchased this solely because it states "by GoPro", it's obviously not by GoPro...... The mount on the right is a GoPro mount, the one on the left is this junk. You can see in my pic the real GoPro mount is a single molded peice. The junk I was sent appears to be two pieces molded together. While comparing them, the plastic of the junk peice is also clearly inferior. I would not trust this mount to hold your GoPro, you may loose it. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! I'm going to complain to Amazon about this misrepresentation.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: This is probably the most versatile GoPro mount that I own. This mount is well made and the clamp is strong.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the most versatile GoPro mount that I own. You can usually find a place to clamp it securely in almost any location. If you use it over water be aware that it will sink like a stone if dropped. I have cut a short section from a foam pool noodle that I slip over the goose neck so that it will float. This mount is well made and the clamp is strong. I would recommend this product. The attached picture was taken using the GoPro Jaws Clamp Mount and my Hero4 Black Edition clamped to the blade of my kayak paddle. Yes, I do trust this mount in "at risk" situations.
customer_reviews.author: Morrowdad

customer_reviews.title: Had high hopes for this...
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews, but I had to for this garbage. I run a non-profit animal rescue and thought this would be a great way to gain some additional video footage from a dog's pov. The gopro harness for the camera itself is well constructed, but that doesn't mean a thing if the straps and connectors don't do their intended job. Terrible choice in straps and clips. the straps constantly come undone. the clips came out of their loops, and the chest plate kept riding down the straps.
customer_reviews.author: A. M.

customer_reviews.title: My Labrador likes it and so do I
customer_reviews.text: Really a neat harness for mounting my Hero7 on my labrador. He doesn't mind it, and still does his job regardless if he's wearing the camera or not! It stays put for the most part, though it does slide to one side or the other slightly during rigorous use. I don't care for the open hook attachment points, I favor strong clips for that type of use but it seems to work ok.
customer_reviews.author: NobodyTouchesTheBlue

customer_reviews.title: Lost the mount and the camera
customer_reviews.text: Lost my camera and the mount attached to my motorcycle during a ride over the weekend. As you can see in the pics, the suction cup mount was on the side panel of the motorcycle. I never got above 70 mph or off-road. Now I am without a camera and mount.
customer_reviews.author: CDOMUS

customer_reviews.title: Headmount is NOT as advertized.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to be able to remove my camera from head strap easily without having to deal with screw mount positioning. NOPE, it is just like my cheap knockoff, looks like they even use the same mold. Molded part has less flow lines/imperfections on my knock off than the name brand. They really need to change the pictures. I am looking into making my own mount as I can find body mounts (4 strap slots) with quick release, but not ones with 3 strap slots for head strap mount. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: frog

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to have a backup tether to hold your camera
customer_reviews.text: Used it properly but it didn't hold. Attached it to the side of my car, even gave it a tug. Now I'm down a mount and a GoPro. Maybe I should've had a backup tether, but still there's responsibility on the company as well to make the product work as advertised. Side note, if any of you find a GoPro on the streets of San Francisco, that's probably mine haha.
customer_reviews.author: Solo

customer_reviews.title: Great for "non-extreme" filming but that's fine by me.
customer_reviews.text: Great Value and use it for my many vacations! If you don't mind having a "generic" product without the GoPro logo, this is definitely the way to go. I can't tell a difference between the two other than that. I wouldn't recommend this product if you are doing anything with a lot of movement (skateboarding, snowboarding, skydiving, cliff diving etc.). This headstrap will most likely fall off and is better for "non-extreme" filming (unfortunately, like the kind I do). If not, I would recommended to use the body strap since it'll be more secure.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT STAY ON
customer_reviews.text: The concept and the hard plates are excellent. The straps are horrible and are this product's downfall: They are made of heavy elastic and have shallow hooks at the ends which are supposed to hook into loops made of the same elastic. These are horrible; they do not stay hooked. The straps themselves loosen easily; they can't be made to stay snug. I almost lost an entire harness and camera but luckily found it. My solution was to replace all of the straps and hardware with nylon webbing and appropriate hardware. Now it works like it should. If I can do this, I fail to see why GoPro doesn't address this very obvious problem with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Animal Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay for the first couple times, then it fell off on a standard side street and got run over by a car. I keep my car clean and there was not dirt or anything on the surface. My mount got destroyed. The GoPro was banged up but still worked. I thought I was playing it safe by getting a GoPro brand mount but not only did I waste my money on this mount, it caused my GoPro to get damaged.
customer_reviews.author: The_Pianoman

customer_reviews.title: Great suction cup
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this suction cup. I recently stuck it to my dirty car to get some video of playing around in the snow, and it stuck like it was glued on! I recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor_G

customer_reviews.title: Works good BUT watch a video on how to use Before using it
customer_reviews.text: It's not that this is a bad unit. It works like they say it will. But and this is getting to be a very old story for Gopro and its accessories: They don't include instructions on how to use it properly. Yes, there's videos you can search the internet for but what if you are in a location where you can't get an internet connection? I took away a star for this. Gopro needs to address this issue with their products yesterday so people like me who are die hard Gopro users will continue to buy their products.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Essential Tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool has been very helpful to me over the years. I use it almost every time I mount my GoPro. It just allows you to get the GoPro very tight so it doesn't move at all. It also helps you unscrew it from any mount easily. Mine has never fallen apart or bent. Many people might not see it as necessary but sometimes when you hand tighten your GoPro it still moves since its such a small plastic screw. It is also helpful when your hands are cold. Don't over look this, I believe you'll use it much more than you think.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah

customer_reviews.title: Was Skeptical, But It's The Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: Some GoPro accessories are overpriced, and I thought that might be the case here. But when I got the kit, the quality of the materials and design was impressive. Tested it at highway speeds, and it worked great. You get more than just the mount itself, and that adds to the value. I think that the Panavise suction cup mount with the threaded base is actually the best design, quickest to adjust, and most versatile, but this GoPro mount is probably most secure for high speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Willie V. HughesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Grips really well, unless object is skinny
customer_reviews.text: Really nice GoPro accessory, super versatile and simple in application, but very effective! The only situation that this accessory is not very viable is when you are trying to clamp to a slim or skinny surface or object such as a basketball rim, car window or some bed frames. Has a rubber adjustable strap on the inside of the mouth of the clamp that is supposed to help with that purpose and it does an okay job of it. Recommended for sure, can be used in alot of situations
customer_reviews.author: CD Head

customer_reviews.title: Needs some tweaks
customer_reviews.text: On paper this is a wonderful little tool. When you really need to ratchet down the GoPro, this can do it. When you then have to remove the GoPro, this tool is essential. The issue is that the tolerances aren't great. You'd think a tool made by GoPro specifically for the GoPro mounting system would be exact. It isn't. There is a lot of wiggle room and the black plastic is less than ideal for a part that is used to exert significant torque. With a few design changes I think this could be an indispensable tool. In fact, as designed, it should probably come with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Floats never been used. Bestbuy on Left Amazon on Right
customer_reviews.text: Not all GoPro floaty's are the same quality , Ive found stock sold by Amazon to be a tad thicker & larger then those stocked at Bestbuy. What does this mean? pretty simple really , Buy the Amazon version & your gopro will have more float.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: I'm still not sure what it does
customer_reviews.text: I got this to unscrew the bolt without carrying pliers. It does that, but it also does more. I'm not sure what 100% of the features are. It's make of ok materials. It's gopro, over priced accessories and you likely find a knock off brand making one 3x's better for half the cost. May I also note: Why a bottle opener? everything has to be a bottle opener these days... I'm super confused.
customer_reviews.author: You can call me Sir

customer_reviews.title: Great Product as long as you have common sense
customer_reviews.text: I see a lot of reviews about how GoPro made this cheap with plastic parts... let me start by saying this is supposed to float so what other lightweight material would you expect for a reasonable price? Common sense... Also, do not over tighten this as it will cause the plastic to break... more common sense. I brought this to Havasu Falls and use it in out pool and other hiking trips. It has been used by my friends with common sense and still works like a charm and no pieces are broken. I would recommend this to anyone with COMMON SENSE
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get your Dramamine Ready.
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed by thousands of positive reviews.. I am a professional dog walker and tried it a few times on different dogs and walked away dizzied by the video using the GoPro alone..completely unusable unless the dogs remained still. I went to a gimbal after that with some improvements but can only be used on the back mount. Mounting on the chest was impossible due to the weight and space between strides. The verdict on my end is that I’m sad I purchased. Low expectations from this item is what you should have going.. more gimmick than useful
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Hopper

customer_reviews.title: Unlike some of the knock-off chest harnesses, this thing actually will fit an adult.
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about the real GoPro chest harness is the length of the straps. This thing can be adjusted to fit an adult, whereas some of the cheap knock-offs have straps that are so short that they would only fit a child. I tried a couple of the knock-offs available on Amazon, found that they were choking the life out of me, and opted to try the GoPro product, which finally worked out. That’s not to say this thing is perfect - it’s still a fairly cheaply made product, all said and done. But in my mind it’s worth the price jump to have a product that actually fits me.
customer_reviews.author: Shenanuke

customer_reviews.title: Strongest GoPro suction cup mount
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a number of suction cup mounts for my GoPro HERO4 Silver. This one is the strongest and sticks the best. The suction cup itself is made of a softer, thicker material than others that I've tried and it conforms to the surface better. The suction button and lock are different than others that I've used and they are very effective. The one thing that could be done to improve this mount is to allow it to rotate where it attaches to the camera frame or case.
customer_reviews.author: maulepilot

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, the cam was not on it at the ...
customer_reviews.text: It fell off my motorcycle tank. Fortunately, the cam was not on it at the time.
customer_reviews.author: Ruslan Fazlyev

customer_reviews.title: Average quality. Would not trust for bike/motorcycle/skiing where vibration is a factor.
customer_reviews.text: Either it's counterfeit or GoPro licensed their name out to a cheap accessory manufacturer. Packaging has GoPro colors and logos, but is very cheap. Finish and quality of the product is not as good as thethat I also purchased. The reason I bought this was for the articulating feature that I needed to point the camera in any direction while hanging from electrical conduit. It works well for that. I would not trust this to remain tightly fastened on any piece of vibrating or moving equipment. The adjustments don't hold tightly like on my real handlebar mount.
customer_reviews.author: Crispy

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Is not like the one in the image. Please beware and see all reviews with pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Charliebcas

customer_reviews.title: Cool, Durable and Neutrally Buoyant (at 40 feet)
customer_reviews.text: I hate buying accessories from the companies that make items because they are overpriced and poor quality - USUALLY... however this thing is a rockstar, it works well, is small but durable and I used it Scuba diving. Felt safe to use and could do a selfie video :) Now here is an interesting thing, its buoyant at surface, but as you should know as you go deeper buoyancy changes, and it is neutral buoyancy at about 35-40 feet, so if you let go down there it wont shoot up to surface but rather just hang there.. pretty cool and you can do a swim around your neutrally buoyant handler. Well done GoPro (again).
customer_reviews.author: GiggleX

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for GoPrp
customer_reviews.text: If you have a GoPro you must get this for filming in water. I was alwasy worried I'd accidentially lose my $400 GoPro in the lake. This Floaty has a easilly seen high visability color, comes with a back door for both the older and newer GoPro Housings and the 3m Adhesive pad is very reliable. I no longer think twice taking my GoPro out on Lake Winnipesaukee!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: So Disappointed 😞
customer_reviews.text: Wow, love this camera! I received it as a birthday gift and had it for 2 weeks. Then we used the suction cup (we had previously used it with 100% success). However on our latest excursion, the suction cup did not do its job and we lost our GP8 Hero Black😞. GONE. I will buy another GP, but I was hoping GP would assist me on the costs??? I love the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK mount, but difficult to lock camera into position
customer_reviews.text: I used this mount for years before the plastic on the mount finally broke, so it holds up fairly well. However, there are a couple things I didn't like about it. 1. There's no way to lock the GoPro into the same position when you put it back into the mount, so I would have to play around to get it positioned correctly every time. 2. To keep the camera from moving while bicycling, I had to tighten down the mount screw as much as possible, which also made it difficult to loosen.
customer_reviews.author: JohnDoe

customer_reviews.title: Essential for water activities
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to a hard case for the gopro hero 8. It attaches easily to any hard case and was able to float a got pro, hard case, and an entire chest harness in the water. Excellent choice for using the gopro with any water sports.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: A must have accessory for your gopro.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a suction cup accessory for your gopro this is it!!!! I bought a cheap version and although it stuck on the windshield the footage was super shakey on the gopro 4. I bought this and the footage is wayyyy better. More stable looking with minor shake. The suction cup sticks and stays on like and new born being breast fed! Dont buy the cheap versions buy this and you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: joel

customer_reviews.title: Replacement Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this goose neck to replace my brother's copy. After he used it for a month or so, I wanted to remove it from the clamp he attached it to for a different loadout. Without much pressure one of the locking tabs snapped right off. I guess functionally these goose necks are fine, but the fact that the locking mechanism is brittle makes me question whether or not I should purchase a replacement in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: sLok

customer_reviews.title: I mean, what can I say, this thing likes to stick.
customer_reviews.text: Gopro you've outdone yourself again. This suction cup is so versatile I have yet to find a spot on my car I can't put it. I never have to worry about it falling off as this is probably the strongest suction cup I have ever used for my gopros. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dog, she is a chocolate lab. My only complaint of this is that after a little while it seems to start sliding around. I have to go and re adjust it. Not the end of the world but slightly annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Colin W.

customer_reviews.title: Most important thing to know? It floats.
customer_reviews.text: And it floats good. Put it on the GoPro (especially if you don't have a floaty handle) and your GoPro will float and be easy to spot! Only downside (but it should be obvious and not surprise anyone) is that it covers the screen so you can't see/operate the screen with this floaty. If that will be a deal breaker for you (and I understand) I'd recommend the floaty stick/handle instead.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Top notch handle grip
customer_reviews.text: The GoPro handler is great for all of your underwater action cam ventures, whether at a pool or the open seas. The foam handle makes it easy and comfortable to grip, and the lanyard will prevent you from dropping or losing your camera. It is not exclusive for water, as you can use it as a regular grip while on land. It floats, so if you do drop your camera (at a pool) it comes up to the surface so you won't have to swim down to retrieve it. Finally, it comes with the screw tool to make sure the thumbscrew is not loose when you mount your action cam, so that is an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Spartano15

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT Work with Soft Boards
customer_reviews.text: These are basically just bigger versions of the GoPro sticky pads, with a backup in case it fails. As usual with GoPro, the quality is very high, and so is the price for what you're buying. I bought these as a beginner surfer, but I was unaware that it would not work with a soft board. It should work with any hard board, but it wouldn't stick at all to the board I was using, so it was basically a waste of $12 for me.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Houde

customer_reviews.title: Industrial Strength..  They aren't kidding!
customer_reviews.text: They claim 150mph+... Confirmed. I've stuck this thing to a variety of spots on my car and it hangs on. At first I was worried about it flying off but not anymore. My friend used thing to pull a dent out of his car, it's that strong. Just make sure the spot you are sticking it to is clean. A) for suction and B) so you don't scratch your car. I just spray a little quick detailer with a micro fiber to clean the surface first. 5 Star!
customer_reviews.author: Nick T.

customer_reviews.title: NO ASSEMBLY OR IMPLEMENTATION INSTRUCTION
customer_reviews.text: Same problem as others have had due to NO PRODUCT INFO OR INSTRUCTIONS! I will figure it out but did want to warn others who may not be mechanically inclined or take time to figure this assembly out.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Paine

customer_reviews.title: Worried about losing my camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to mount my GoPro Hero 3 on my microlight trike aircraft, but tightening down the bolts bends the brackets so much I worry about them snapping and my camera plummeting to the ground to its ultimate demise. I ended up tightening just enough to hold, and then running a few zip ties around everything as an extra precaution. Further, the bolts aren't enclosed in the brackets. While this allows for easy on-off, if one gets loose from vibration, the whole thing can come off. Ok for non-critical applications, but next time I'll get something more solid. Photo taken with camera on this mount.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome - if you aren't too tall.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with one exception. So it straps to your head or your hat great. The only thing that doesn't work great is the perspective of the GoPro if you are 6'3" tall. The reason is pretty simple, and I just wish I had realized it before purchasing. This places the camera about 2" above your eyes. So for me it makes the video from the perspective of someone 6'5" or 6'6" tall. Add in the fisheye lens, and you've got a weird perspective. I would recommend this to anyone 5'10" or shorter. It would also be great for children.
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: Firm, reliable suction mount!
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed by the reliable adhesion of this suction mount to F250 during an off road run over the course of a hot, dry Nevada day. The mount remained firmly attached across rocky, uneven terrain with fully inflated (thus more bouncy off road) tires as we ventured through a unmaintained wash east of Las Vegas. Since then the mount has performed flawlessly on my Jeep, windows, and more! It’s decently flexible allowing for easy adjustment to capture the right angle! If the suction were to fail there’s nothing really included to tie down the mount so adios camera, but a small rope tie to it provides a good back up even though I’ve never needed the fallback!
customer_reviews.author: Ari Morris

customer_reviews.title: Trust me, go with the GoPro brand
customer_reviews.text: I tried cheaper brands & almost lost my camera. The cheaper models break easy if over tightened. Also follow the instructions when applying the part the sticks to your helmet. Clean the area first & let it set over night, if you apply per instructions it will stay secure. I cycle everyday either to work or when I'm out on errands in San Francisco, with all the road construction going on in the city right now its hard to avoid the rough road surfaces. But its holding up well. Pay the extra, it's worth it for your expensive camera.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with camera attachment.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and looks like it would be very secure on your kayak deck if you have a firm place to attach.... not a good device to attach to kayak bungees.. wables. It does not stretch or flex. Also I expected it to be use ready with all the parts included but it does not have the adaptive piece to secure the camera to the device.
customer_reviews.author: Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Great grip for GoPro action cameras.
customer_reviews.text: I am new to the GoPro life but I will say this grip is very well made. The handle is soft and comfortable. I have not used in wet conditions yet but I have no reason to believe it will not perform as advertised. I have however used it and my Hero 7 attaches to it well. Very secure connection. Unit is light weight and has a bright orange base with lanyard for securing to wrist. It’s kind of thick which is nice because my hands are large. Very comfortable to hold.
customer_reviews.author: H. A. Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Holds Like Cement
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I used it for the first time on my Jeep windshield. I had my GoPro 8 on it and took off on some pretty bad roads up in the Cascade Mountains. Even drove on the highway with it on (forgot it was still there). This thing is amazing. Has incredible lever system for ease of putting on and taking off too.
customer_reviews.author: JohnWR

customer_reviews.title: It stayed on, even when muddy wet.
customer_reviews.text: It didn't fall off. Used on a Subaru on some two track, as well as Jeep straight bashing through forest and mud holes. It holds tight and true, the adjustment to get it right was very easy even with the different slope and angle of the windshields. I did run a safety tether for when it does come off, as it is inevitable.
customer_reviews.author: Brian E.

customer_reviews.title: Great hands-free option
customer_reviews.text: Bought the harness for a trip to Costa Rica where I knew I would be ziplinging throught the mountains. Turned out they had helmet mounts but I did use the harness for other activities. Keeps things secure and hands-free. You do have to remember to keep your arms/hands out of the way to not block the view. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get the after market pack
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly the same cheap quality that I got from an aftermarket gopro kit. Price is super jacked up for what you get. I got two suction cups - this and another that came with a aftermarket kit. Cannot tell any difference. The one that I received didn't even have the GoPro logo on it like it shows on the picture. What a shame! Save your money and get the aftermarket one - there's absolutely no difference after all.
customer_reviews.author: LoveBeef

customer_reviews.title: Great, flexible helmet mount
customer_reviews.text: Great, flexible helmet mount I needed a mount for my new ski helmet. I wanted to be able to mount it on the top and this does exactly that. I have a side mount on another ski helmet and don't really know if the top mount or side mount is better but I also use a top mount on my biking helmet and feel that that extra weight directly on top of my head doesn't throw off my balance as much as the side mount. Either way you can't go wrong if you are trying to shoot POV video. The one I received is definitely a go pro product and I've had no issues with it moving once adjusted
customer_reviews.author: BJA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent first person mt. bike footage , just don’t wreck while wearing it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this chest harness for mountain biking to get a better perspective with the front tire and hadlebars in the shot. Comes with its own mount for camera Hint: mount the camera upside down and angle slightly upwards so it points straight ahead while riding. Great footage , a little hot to wear but tolerable. On my first ride with the harness I did a superman over the bars and it felt like I was hit with a sledgehammer as the front mounting plate smashed into my rib cage. Both gopro and harness were not damaged in the crash. ill only wear it again for mountain biking if i have chest armor underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Versatile variety of mounts and buckles to enhance the possibilities for using your GoPro Hero
customer_reviews.text: This grab bag of mounts offers a good assortment of buckles and mounts to enhance the use of your GoPro Hero. By using these parts, either by themselves, or in tandem with the mounts you already own, you can achieve particular angles and placement of your Hero that might otherwise be difficult if not impossible. I'm still waiting for some company to manufacture a line of really high quality aluminum or titanium mounts, but until then, this bag of mounts will help you out in many situations. The price is fair too.
customer_reviews.author: M. Erb

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Are use this as a chin mount on a motorcycle helmet and I think it works great. I have complete confidence that my camera is going to stay in place and it allows me to be able to adjust the angle on the fly. But be careful not to bump it because then you can end up with a whole Lotta video looking at the sky LOL
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, It Floats!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a "gift" after accidentally destroying the one that was already attached to my friend's GoPro. Folks, do not peal off the orange sponge after applying it; it's meant to stay there for the rest of eternity. I'm not sure of the mechanics of it, but there's a latch on the actual plastic door that it comes with -- no need to gorilla grip it and force the actual sponge off. I was stupid... Anyways, since I bought this replacement for her, she seems to have forgiven me.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Morales

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: It’s fine for what it is, but for a GoPro accessory I was expecting more. It looks and feels cheap. Maybe it’s that way because it is supposed to be lightweight? It’s also pretty big... bigger than I was expecting it to be. I was hoping to use it for a camera rig but due to its huge size I’m unable to. Hopefully one day I’ll use it for something.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Look for something else
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking mount. But when I test fitted the black base into this mount, the fit was way too tight. I wrestled with it to release, using my hands at first, then tools, then finally the only thing that worked was my teeth!! Sheesh! I'm all for solid sturdy mount, but the thing needs to release easily. Going to return this. Update... Using an emery board, I sanded the surfboard mounting edges so the black base wasn't such a tight fit. All good now with a little modification.
customer_reviews.author: CA_Kid

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it couldn't handle the terrible roads in our district
customer_reviews.text: Really upset with product. I placed this on our rescue truck to record our response to an incident. I wiped down the surface and suction cup before placing it on the front of the rig. When we returned to the station it was gone. I had all the clamps locked down and the button pressed in but something went wrong. Maybe it couldn't handle the terrible roads in our district. But all I know is that I just lost a very expensive piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Ducharme

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work with Hero 3!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two, one for my Hero 3 Black and one for my Hero 3+ Black. It appears that they sent me an updated version with the Hero 5 backdoor, as well as the "standard" backdoor. Be advised, the "standard" backdoor does NOT work for the original Hero 3! They made the case slightly smaller for the Hero 3+ and 4, which this door is designed to fit. Luckily I had a spare backdoor for my Hero 3 and was still able to use the Floaty with it. If you have a camera older than the Hero 3+, do not order!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Martin

customer_reviews.title: unless wet - reusable (follow instructions) - comes with a indicator that they are dry and good to use - comes in a ziplock bag
customer_reviews.text: A must for the summer and underwater use! Pros - Plenty of inserts included. - 1 insert should last all day, unless wet - reusable (follow instructions) - comes with a indicator that they are dry and good to use - comes in a ziplock bag to keep them dry why not in use One note, if you get water in the lense part of the case, the camera lens and casing lens seal, so it can get foggy in the lens chamber, while the rest of the case is fog free. So this is useless for defogging the lens chamber, but otherwise, its great!
customer_reviews.author: Nate B.

customer_reviews.title: It's working great
customer_reviews.text: So, the suction cup mount itself is great. And the variety of bits for configuring the camera mounting is very good. But the quick release clip broke after four removals from the mount. The seller did a great job (above and beyond, really) of handling that, but the manufacturer needs to fix that. I bought a bag of after market clips and so far, they're doing great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stratton

customer_reviews.title: Missing one piece.
customer_reviews.text: I’m missing an important piece that holds the whole thing together. One of the bolts looked used. Prolly re boxed it and I got the short end of the stick.
customer_reviews.author: IBoughtStuff

customer_reviews.title: Must have accessory for the GoPro traveling
customer_reviews.text: Our whole family loves it. It fits us all, from the 4 year old to mom and dad. We used this GoPro Heady all through our last family vacation. On alpine rollercoaster's in Tennessee, hiking the Everglades, and lots more. It held up perfectly and securely, and still looks like new. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Klccc2000

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my rylo 360 cam
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a 360 action cam (not a GoPro) but it has a similar attaching point but does not come with any type of bucks to use with go pro quick mounts. The 3 department stores I went to locally did not sell the buckle either by it self or in a package. This Grab bag had everything I needed to get my 360 cam to work with any GoPro mounts and comes with a flat and curved mount
customer_reviews.author: Chris d.

customer_reviews.title: Dog is not included :(
customer_reviews.text: Little bummed the dog wasn't included, but other than a little bit of a learning curve I figured out how to adjust the harness to keep it tight and from leaning from one side to the other. It has mounts on the chest and the back for your Gopro. It's a Gopro harness and is built well and my pup has had it on for a few adventures now, he doesn't seem to even know it is there. A+++ Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ReadByListening

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome, and a necessity for anyone looking to have ...
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome, and a necessity for anyone looking to have flexibility for mounting their gopro. I've used it on Skidoos on the ocean at full speed (45mph) without it moving an inch. Anyone who has been on a jetski on a bumpy lake, or in the ocean, you would understand how good this has to be in order to survive the hard bumps, wind, water, and everything else that's thrown at it. I wouldn't hesitate to use it on a car at higher speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t stay straight
customer_reviews.text: For walking and running back an fourth its ok.. I took our golden for a 3 mile hike and it wouldn't stop turning over from the top to her side, it's pretty much worthless. I'm going to try to adapt a regular harness and put a go pro mount on it.
customer_reviews.author: streetglide18

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit item. Does not match photo.
customer_reviews.text: This is not the official chesty mount that is pictured in the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Blake

customer_reviews.title: I found that it's just as easy to tighten the mounting screws with my fingers
customer_reviews.text: Not a must have. I found that it's just as easy to tighten the mounting screws with my fingers. It does come in handy when releasing the camera housing clamp in cold environments and my fingers are numb. You know how cold hurts, and the tips of your fingers feel like they are being stabbed with a bamboo needle? Yeah, it eliminates THAT feeling. LoL. Otherwise, just a neat little tool if you're one of those people (like me) who have to have "all" the accessories that come with your gadgets. Very high quality - as we've come to expect from GoPro. Small and lightweight, you'll definitely want to tie a lanyard to it to avoid losing it.
customer_reviews.author: The Sheepherder

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and useful!
customer_reviews.text: Well, what a neat and cute item to have. You can have this for $5! "Can't you just use your finger to unscrew?! You'd save $5!" I know, but it's not the only thing that's useful for. It can be used as bottle opener, too. It just looks pretty. I think it is one of first accessories you should get for your GoPro. I'm happy I bought it. It's designed beautifully. Materials used feels nice! Great for anyone especially who has weak fingers, or hands tend to be wet, Tool is here to help. It's keychain ready, so you can always have it with you all the time. A really convenient item to own, on the go!
customer_reviews.author: Mental

customer_reviews.title: Clip will break.  As stated by multiple other reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I use the to mount the camera for baseball games. First one broke after a few months and second lasted a few weeks. Unfortunately it was after the return time as it spent a lot of time in the box as a result of COVID. Look for an alternative as this one has a major design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Not very secure
customer_reviews.text: It’s great when you need to free up your hands but it doesn’t feel very sturdy or secure. Got this to wear during mario kart and the whole time I was worried about this flying off. If there was a way to make this more secure, it would be a 5 star
customer_reviews.author: vcw

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: The nut is not glued to the mount and departs after each use - keep an eye on it. More importantly, one of the 'arms' or 'teeth', whichever, broke after only a few uses. Not sure if the product is warranted for this failure.
customer_reviews.author: J.P. Mizell

customer_reviews.title: If you make car videos with GoPro, you should have one of these 100%
customer_reviews.text: My old suction cup mount, though cheap, could move when I was driving through corners and braking. Although the official GoPro mount is about three times more expensive, it really is a peace of mind. Very sturdy and no problem handling 100mph and corners. If you make car videos, this is a must-have. I might find alternatives to other accessories but this is an exception. After all we don't want our precious camera to break or move around during filming. If anyone is interested, I make car review videos and my YouTube channel is: What We Drive. Welcome to check it out!
customer_reviews.author: Tian Qin

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Does the job though not really necessary as thumb tightening is enough. However, if a GoPro mount bolt was on too tight, I’m sure this would do the trick. Have not tried opening a bottle with it. Little tool will likely have been lost when I discover I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Product I received was missing 2/3 of the parts and was a cheap plastic fake. It did not come in actual GoPro packaging or even have a proper label. If it had all the parts it could possibly be an "okay" product but receiving cheap fakes makes it hard to judge. UPDATE: Amazon asked me to order the item again, this time from a different seller. Same story. Received fake piece of junk in a used sandwich bag missing swivel arm. If you ordered this from anyone BUT Amazon you are probably using a counterfeit and missing parts. This probably explains the people saying it has not swivel and breaks easily.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Jay Hayes

customer_reviews.title: 3 pieces 1 comes with GoPro and 1 with chesty already.
customer_reviews.text: Great if you want replacements for the chesty or the stock mount...the only one I really needed was the swivel mount for those different angles. Good quality either way. Just wish it had a new type of mount other than defaults with chesty and GoPro stock.
customer_reviews.author: Geodeguy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and effective
customer_reviews.text: I strapped this on my head and biked all over am island called formenterra. The footage was amazing. It was so comfortable I forgot it was there and almost walked into a bathroom with it. Oops!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Zeman

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to, seems well made
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much a necessity for using with a GoPro when you're changing housings and mountings and such. I can use it to get things secured better and more tightly, and then I also need it to undo it. When I'm diving, I'll take it with me on the dive boat. The silver part is metal, the black part is plastic, but it seems well made (despite the plastic). I haven't used it as a bottle opener, but I guess that's a nice touch. The keychain or string loop is also nice. And for $5, to get things more secure than I can do by hand, it pretty much seems like a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: tightened all the way down to fit my 14lb terrier
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, mounts work, what else can I say about an original GoPro accessory? I might cut the excess straps so fitting it is less cumbersome. The design is just fine and the elastic seems to be comfortable on my little guy. We have to frequently adjust the camera mount when he bumps into things, as expected. Wash and hang dry just fine. Footage is priceless!
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Using for Live Streaming
customer_reviews.text: If you use your HERO 4 like I do, connecting to a live stream video source, this cable is needed. I first bought a 3rd party version, but those cables seem to be large on the micro side. I need to connect the HDMI and a power source, which this cable will do. Along with an adapter, you can use your GoPro in a live stream situation.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Powers @Geekazine

customer_reviews.title: Super high quality wrench for GoPro accessories!
customer_reviews.text: I have literally bought about 8 of these. It is one of my favorite products to buy on Amazon. This tool is indispensable when working with your GoPros and accessories. It's made with high-quality materials. Being that it is a add-on item I usually wait till I have a purchase over $25 and add this to the purchase. So will I buy this again? Probably many more times. At 4 bucks it makes it a steal. Cheap enough to have one for every box and every tripod you own. A must-have!
customer_reviews.author: J peters

customer_reviews.title: not for small dogs below 15 lbs
customer_reviews.text: Even tho this is a reallybfood product, This is big for my 12 lb dog, they should say medium-sized dogs and bigger, its really not for small dogs. But it is durable and would be perfect for an active outdoor big dog
customer_reviews.author: troy c.

customer_reviews.title: LOST MY BRAND NEW GO PRO HERO SESSION BECAUSE THIS DID NOT STICK
customer_reviews.text: Used this mount for the first time ever this past weekend. I paired this with my Hero session and took it skiing. I stuck it to my helmet and went down a slope and next thing I know, it fell off. Followed all instructions to properly mount it. I lost my $200 Hero Session and checked the lost and found and it was not there. I knew a little sticky thing would not secure it. I should be refunded $200 for a brand new go pro this item was a piece of crap seriously
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Love this mount
customer_reviews.text: Love this mount. The clamp is REALLY strong and has a neat adjustable strap that allows you to reduce the "empty space" in the back of the jaws which affords a very tight grip on small diameter objects. The goose neck is stiff enough to hold its position but can be adjusted with a little more effort that anticipated. I would rather have it a little stiff and maintain its position that a little loser and allow camera drift. As always, this GoPro mount is wave over priced....but I keep buying them!
customer_reviews.author: David A

customer_reviews.title: This really could be better. While yes
customer_reviews.text: This really could be better. While yes, it does what it says it does, there is much room for improvement. First and foremost, all of the thumbscrews used to keep this in place may work for temporary applications, but I purchased this to be mounted to the handlebars of my bicycle permanently. Locking up my bike on the streets of NYC, I worried about someone just undoing the thumb screws and walking away with the mount and housing (I obviously never keep the camera in the housing when locked up). I ultimately ended up buying a K-EDGE Pro machined metal mount for my handlebars, wish GoPro made a similar product for those of us looking for a semi-permanent mounting solution.
customer_reviews.author: specik

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I might look a bit strange wearing the "Headstrap Mount" attached to my noggin, while kayaking. Not so much, though, when I "Quick Clip" it to the back of a ball cap. But, either way it feels comfortable and secure. And, usually, I'm the only one on the water creating cinematography. Wow! It's totally intuitive and I've found the fit of the 'GoPro Headstrap' to be very comfortable thanks to the inch and a half wide straps, fully adjustable and secure. It does the job providing hands free mobility and no more having to stop paddling in order to take a photograph. Results are similar when using the "Quick Clip".
customer_reviews.author: Bill Oterson

customer_reviews.title: Solid, would be perfect if it would swivel
customer_reviews.text: Very well-constructed with lots of mounting options. I have to say though that I'm surprised and disappointed that there's no swivel feature, considering everything else they throw in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Jovian

customer_reviews.title: It floats!
customer_reviews.text: Nice floating handle for GoPro. I like the lanyard and that it can be made tighter in case I drop it while scuba diving. I just returned from a scuba diving trip and loved the way the footage turned out when scuba diving while holding the handle. I also didn't hesitate to let go of it when I needed a free hand to climb into the dive boat because the lanyard would fit tightly around my wrist with the sliding adjuster. Even if it had slipped off my rest, it floats! Wish the handle was a little longer or came as a telescopic handle.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Really sucks -- as it should!
customer_reviews.text: This suction cup mount really does a nice job with my GoPro Hero4 Silver. I've used it attached to the outside of a few cars, even up to highway speeds, and it holds nicely. Naturally, I did add a string tether as backup but the suction cup held just fine. When removed after about an hour of use, it felt just as secure as when I first put it on. I also have an inexpensive suction cup mount that came with one of those accessory bundles and there's no way I would ever use that one in any place except a stationary, zero risk environment. Overall, this mount really sucks -- as it should.
customer_reviews.author: JoeyNick

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality and useful product.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this thing and love it. I wish I waited a few days now that it's $5 (I spent $8, w/e), but it's definitely worth buying. Nice matte like finish so it doesn't really shine or get oily or dirty from your finger or anything else. Mostly what I like is that it is one sided, so you don't really have to be careful in aligning the thrum screw perfectly to get a good grip, you just place it on and start turning. Very light weight, can opener is a nice touch, a great addition to my keys.
customer_reviews.author: Aryeh Pekker

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money/time.
customer_reviews.text: This is essentially a plastic tube that is connected to a grip. The tube is bulky and noisy. The clamp is so hard to open that I had to use all my weight to open it. I am not sure how this is getting good reviews. I also bought it because someone mentioned they use it to connect to their backpack and that is what I wanted as well. No way. This thing is way too big for that.
customer_reviews.author: Shelia boudreaux

customer_reviews.title: All parts may not be included
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware: The listing states that it includes the following: "Comes with pivoting arms to allow for 3-way adjustability, allowing you to get the angle you want" I ordered these because I wanted the additional pivoting arms since I broke the one that came with my GoPro. It may have been an oversight with my order, as the only thing I received were 2 seat post mounts. Nothing else. The two other adapters (pivoting arms) which provide the 3-way adjustments, as shown in the pics were not included in my order, so I ended up returning this. Side note, the quality seems to be similar to that of which you receive from GoPro.
customer_reviews.author: chjone

customer_reviews.title: but this has been the best by far
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a mediocre quality head strap, but after two paintball outings I can say it has exceeded all my expectations. I have used several accessories for my GoPro, but this has been the best by far. It provides a very good point of view, is grippy, and on the cheaper side. So far nothing has faded or gotten damaged, despite getting shot in the headstrap with paintballs at close range and two washes in hot water. I will update in the near future if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: PizzaTek

customer_reviews.title: Brutally strong.  Can take anything you hand it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is strong. And I needed it to be. (Mounted it on my balcony 300' up where the wind can get very high) Wind? Doesn't bother this beast in the least. Also that clamp? Crazy strong. This device is very good value all considered. I would pay a lot more for it if I had to, knowing how good it is.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S. Luenser

customer_reviews.title: nifty tool
customer_reviews.text: nifty little tool to just have on hand. ensures that the camera is screwed on tight enough, especially helpful when you have frozen fingers when it's cold. it's a pretty "extra" tool, but when it's cheap and on sale, sure why not.
customer_reviews.author: vcw

customer_reviews.title: Its tight...
customer_reviews.text: A solid product from GoPro; it works as it should and seems to be built too last. However, the size it an issue; adjusted all the way out it fits my torso, but anything beyond a light jacket and it isn't going to fit. I'm average size at 5'10" and 175. I deducted a star because the harness should have more adjustment in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: rodney hurst

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.text: Best $35 i ever spent, make sure to make your dog comfortable in this. Id suggest to walk him in it or play prior to making a video so your dog isnt scared of the mount on his/her back. I played fetch with my dog for about 20 min then 20 mon with the camera the next day then filmed on day 3 and he doesnt even care if it on him now. But all is well and its a fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: SHERM

customer_reviews.title: Worked great as we recorded our in vehicle travels to and ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this during a week long TN vacation in the Smoky Mountains. Worked great as we recorded our in vehicle travels to and from our destinations along with the wildlife along the way. Very sturdy, suction cup is thick and strong. Easily configurable for many applications
customer_reviews.author: David B

product_meta.title: GoPro Suction Cup Mount (GoPro Official Mount)
product_meta.description:
Style:Suction Cup Mount| Pattern Name:Suction Cup MountThis slim, lightweight housing can be used as a spare or replacement for Hero3 or Hero3+ cameras. The flat glass lens delivers maximum image sharpness above and below water. Large buttons make it easy to control the camera -even while wearing gloves or mittens. Waterproof to 131'/40M. Includes standard + skeleton backdoors.

SET CONTAINS:
• Suction Cup • Adjustable Arms • Standard Base • Quick Release Base • Drawstring Bag
feature_bullets: Attach your GoPro to cars, boats, motorcycles and more
Industrial strength suction cup proven at speeds of 150+ mph
Engineered to provide a broad range of motion and stability
Quick release base makes moving between shots and locations quick and convenient

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars21,411 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
